prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Trucy Wright
Description: A particular set of circumstances led to her being adopted by Mr. Wright. A world-class magician on the rise.
Character 1
Name: Athena Cykes
Description: The youngest lawyer in our agency. She apparently studied psychology in Europe.
Character 2
Name: Phoenix Wright
Description: My boss. He taught me a lot about what it means to be a lawyer.
Character 3
Name: Nahyuta Sahdmadhi
Description: A prosecutor from Khura'in. He's also a monk, which explains why he's known as the "Last Rites Prosecutor."
Character 4
Name: Dhurke Sahdmadhi
Description: Leader of the Defiant Dragons, and the man who raised me. He was a lawyer once.
Character 5
Name: Archie Buff
Description: An archeologist in Kurain Village. He was asked by someone to study the Founder's Orb.
Character 6
Name: Datz Are'bal
Description: A member of the Defiant Dragons, and Dhurke's right-hand man. He's always been one to laugh at just about anything.
Character 7
Name: Ema Skye
Description: A detective. It looks like she finally became the forensics investigator she always wanted to be.
Character 8
Name: Paul Atishon
Description: He's looking to represent Kurain Village. His remarkable self-confidence is blinding.
Character 9
Name: Sergeant Buff → Armie Buff
Description: The doctor's reclusive child. He lost his mother in a fire.
Character 10
Name: Pearl Fey
Description: Ms. Maya Fey's cousin. She's also one of Kurain Village's spirit mediums. She's always really courteous.
Character 11
Name: Miles Edgeworth
Description: Mr. Wright's best friend and the district's chief prosecutor. His frilly cravat makes a strong fashion statement.
Character 12
Name: Maya Fey
Description: Mr. Wright's former assistant. She's currently training in Khura'in. I'm told she can channel the dead.
Character 13
Name: Inga Karkhuul Khura'in
Description: Khura'in's Minister of Justice and the kingdom's second-in-command.
Character 14
Name: Rayfa Padma Khura'in
Description: Daughter of Ga'ran and princess of Khura'in who is more than a little spoiled.
Character 15
Name: Ga'ran Sigatar Khura'in
Description: The grand priestess and queen of Khura'in. It's said that she can channel the dead.
Character 16
Name: Nayna
Description: Rayfa's attendant. She disappeared all of a sudden after Minister Inga's death.
Character 17
Name: Ahlbi Ur'gaid
Description: When not undergoing monastic training, this plucky kid works as a tour guide.
Character 18
Name: Amara Sigatar Khura'in
Description: The previous queen. She is a spirit medium known as the grand priestess and possesses incredible spiritual power.
Character 19
Name: Trucy Wright
Description: An aspiring magician and my daughter. I adopted her nine years ago.
Character 20
Name: Athena Cykes
Description: The newest lawyer in my office with a background in psychology.
Character 21
Name: Apollo Justice
Description: A reliable subordinate at my office. Serious and hot-blooded with vocal chords made of steel.
Character 22
Name: Nahyuta Sahdmadhi
Description: A Khura'inese prosecutor and monk. He's also known as the "Last Rites Prosecutor."
Character 23
Name: Dhurke Sahdmadhi
Description: Leader of the Defiant Dragons and Apollo's adoptive father.
Character 24
Name: Datz Are'bal
Description: The Defiant Dragons' XO and Dhurke's right-hand man. He will laugh at just about anything.
Character 25
Name: Ema Skye
Description: A detective with a love of science. She's finally achieved her dream of becoming a forensics investigator.
Character 26
Name: Miles Edgeworth
Description: The district's chief prosecutor and my childhood friend. We used to go head-to-head back in his courtroom days.
Character 27
Name: Maya Fey
Description: A practitioner of the Kurain Channeling Technique. We used to take on all sorts of cases together.
Character 28
Name: Inga Karkhuul Khura'in
Description: Khura'in's Minister of Justice. He was killed during the hostage exchange.
Character 29
Name: Rayfa Padma Khura'in
Description: A Khura'inist priestess and crown princess of Khura'in. Her Divination Séances show the last memories of the dead.
Character 30
Name: Ga'ran Sigatar Khura'in
Description: The grand priestess and queen of Khura'in. It's said that she can channel the dead.
Character 31
Name: Nayna
Description: Rayfa's attendant. She disappeared all of a sudden after Minister Inga's death.
Character 32
Name: Ahlbi Ur'gaid
Description: When not undergoing monastic training, this plucky kid works as a tour guide.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: My beloved attorney's badge. Wearing it gets me raring to go.
Evidence 1
Name: Founder's Orb
Description: A national treasure of the Kingdom of Khura'in. None but those of in the royal family have laid eyes on it. Heating the Founder's Orb revealed the statue within. The founder's form has appeared from within. It seems only the queen knows the founder's real name.
Evidence 2
Name: Photo of My Father
Description: A picture of my biological father, Jove Justice, who died in Khura'in.
Evidence 3
Name: Study Photo
Description: Atishon saw Datz fleeing the scene the night of the murder. One of the books is stained with coffee. [caption] The victim is lying in the study next to floor-to-ceiling windows with clear glass. He is covered by books.
Evidence 4
Name: Study Diagram
Description: A diagram of the doctors's study. Note the bookcase, large window, and second-floor area. [caption] There is a tree outside the large floor-to-ceiling window. On the other side of the window is the bookshelf.
Evidence 5
Name: Research Notes
Description: Research notes on the Song of Ceremony and the box containing the Founder's Orb.
Evidence 6
Name: Orb Transfer Agreement
Description: States: "I agree to hand over the Founder's Orb to the Defiant Dragons if I will come to no harm."
Evidence 7
Name: Sarge's Drone
Description: A helicopter drone operated by the doctor's kid. Equipped with a camera and a microphone.
Evidence 8
Name: Glowing Moss
Description: Stuck to the insole of the doctor's boot. It probably got there when he went to hide the Founder's Orb.
Evidence 9
Name: E-Mail
Description: Data obtained from the doctor's computer. Includes a report on his research into the Founder's Orb. Found on the computer in Archie Buff's study, it was sent from Buff to "PAW-711@nmail" as a reply to an earlier email concerning his research into the Founder's Orb.
Evidence 10
Name: Doctor's Reading Glasses
Description: The doctor's poor eyesight meant he couldn't read anything without these. They were found on his desk.
Evidence 11
Name: Raincoat
Description: Seems the doctor wore this last night. Bears a distinctive yellow and green two-tone design.
Evidence 12
Name: Robbery Report
Description: A report filed a year ago by one Mr. Paul Atishon-Wimperson for the theft of the Crystal of Ami Fey.
Evidence 13
Name: Dr. Buff's Autopsy Report
Description: Dr. Buff was struck with the corner of some object. The time of death is between 10 and 11 PM.
Evidence 14
Name: Armie's Statement
Description: She'd fled to her room when she realized someone had moved her while she'd been unconscious on the second floor.
Evidence 15
Name: Inga's Autopsy Report
Description: Stabbed from behind. Cause of death is blood loss. Time of death is approximately 3 PM.
Evidence 16
Name: Tomb Diagram
Description: A diagram of the crime scene. Amara's sarcophagus is in the very center of the room.
Evidence 17
Name: Tomb Crime Photo
Description: A photo of Inga's body. He was stabbed in the back with a knife.
Evidence 18
Name: Gemstone
Description: Inga's button, discovered in the ashes of the tomb's incense burners. Caked in soot.
Evidence 19
Name: Pink Butterfly Pendant
Description: A pendant adorned with a pink butterfly. Seems it belongs to Dhurke. Stained with the victim's blood. A locket found at the crime scene. It actually belongs to Amara.
Evidence 20
Name: Mysterious Bloodstain
Description: A bloodstain from Amara's Tomb. Analysis reveals that it's Dhurke's blood.
Evidence 21
Name: Painkiller Shots
Description: The medication Inga used for his back pain. Said to make the pain disappear.
Evidence 22
Name: Inga's Notepad
Description: A notepad used by Inga. People's characteristics are written inside.
Evidence 23
Name: Woman's Photo
Description: A photo showing Dhurke and Amara's life on the run about 23 years ago.
Evidence 24
Name: Channeling Photo
Description: A picture taken at around 2 PM of the channeling rite.
Evidence 25
Name: Ahlbi's Statement
Description: At around 2 PM, Shah'do was surprised by a firecracker, ran into the courtyard, and stole Nayna's hat.
Evidence 26
Name: Amara's Assassination File
Description: A file containing a ton of info on the assassination of Amara Sigatar Khura'in.
Evidence 27
Name: Dhurke's Law Book
Description: A document establishing the Defense Culpability Act in the name of the queen.
Evidence 28
Name: Dhurke's Badge
Description: The symbol of Dhurke's creed: "A dragon never yields." Nahyuta never confiscated it.
Evidence 29
Name: Dhurke's Corpse Photo
Description: More than three days have passed since his death death. He was shot three times in the chest.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: The police have had their eye on Dr. Buff for some time.
Person: Ema
Testimony 1
Testimony: And just today, a number of stolen artifacts were discovered in his study.
Person: Ema
Testimony 2
Testimony: Among them were a priceless urn and a statue that were stolen from the Fey clan.
Person: Ema
Testimony 3
Testimony: It seems the doctor would do anything to study artifacts, including steal them.
Person: Ema
Testimony 4
Testimony: As for the relic at the center of this dispute, he likely stole it from the Atishon residence.
Person: Ema

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let's tackle this problem step by step. I need to find which evidence and testimony contradict each other. The user provided a list of characters, evidences, and testimonies, and I have to pick one pair that contradicts.

First, I'll go through each testimony and see which evidence might conflict with it. Let's look at the testimonies first:

Testimony 0 (Ema): The police have had their eye on Dr. Buff for some time.
Testimony 1 (Ema): And just today, a number of stolen artifacts were discovered in his study.
Testimony 2 (Ema): Among them were a priceless urn and a statue that were stolen from the Fey clan.
Testimony 3 (Ema): It seems the doctor would do anything to study artifacts, including steal them.
Testimony 4 (Ema): As for the relic at the center of this dispute, he likely stole it from the Atishon residence.

Now, looking at the evidences:

Evidence 12 is a Robbery Report from a year ago by Paul Atishon-Wimperson for the theft of the Crystal of Ami Fey. The testimony mentions stolen artifacts including items from the Fey clan. If the robbery report is from a year ago, and Ema is talking about recent findings in Dr. Buff's study, maybe there's a contradiction here. The testimony claims that the doctor stole the items, but the robbery report was filed by Atishon, not Buff. Wait, but the Robbery Report is about the theft of the Crystal of Ami Fey by someone else (PAW-711?), so if Ema says Buff stole it, but the report was by Atishon, that might not directly contradict. Hmm.

Looking at Testimony 2: mentions stolen items from the Fey clan. The Robbery Report (Evidence 12) is about the Crystal of Ami Fey being stolen, reported by Atishon. If the doctor (Buff) is accused of stealing it, but the report was from a year ago by Atishon, maybe that's conflicting. Because if the Crystal was stolen by someone else (as per the report), then Buff couldn't have stolen it again? Or maybe the report is about the same incident, but the testimony claims Buff did it, while the report might implicate someone else. Wait, the Robbery Report says it was filed by Paul Atishon-Wimperson, so perhaps the theft was reported by him, but the perpetrator wasn't Buff. Therefore, if Ema says Buff stole it, that contradicts the report's details. But I need to check the exact descriptions.

Looking at Evidence 12's description: "A report filed a year ago by one Mr. Paul Atishon-Wimperson for the theft of the Crystal of Ami Fey." So the theft was reported by Atishon, but the testimony (Testimony 2) says the stolen items included the Crystal (from the Fey clan). If the report was about that theft, then the thief wasn't Buff, so Ema's testimony that Buff stole it would contradict that. Because the Robbery Report (Evidence 12) is about a theft reported by Atishon, but doesn't say Buff did it. So if the police have evidence that Buff stole it (Testimony 1-2), but the robbery report (Evidence 12) is from the victim (Atishon) about a past theft, then maybe the testimonies are talking about a different theft. Alternatively, maybe the items mentioned in Testimony 2 (urn and statue) are different from the Crystal in Evidence 12. Wait, the testimony mentions "a priceless urn and a statue" as part of the stolen artifacts found in Buff's study. The Robbery Report is about the Crystal of Ami Fey. So maybe those are separate items. The contradiction would be if the testimony claims Buff stole the Crystal, but the robbery report was about that theft, implying someone else did it. Or perhaps the report is about the same items but the testimony attributes them to Buff, conflicting with the report's details. Alternatively, maybe the Robbery Report's perpetrator isn't Buff, so the testimony's claim that Buff stole it would contradict the report's info. 

Alternatively, looking at Evidence 6: Orb Transfer Agreement states "I agree to hand over the Founder's Orb to the Defiant Dragons if I will come to no harm." If the testimony talks about the relic (Founder's Orb) being stolen by Buff from Atishon, but the agreement shows Buff (or someone else) was supposed to hand it over, maybe that's conflicting. But the testimony says the relic at the center is the one stolen from Atishon, but the agreement is about transferring the Founder's Orb, so perhaps the relic in question is the Founder's Orb, which was supposed to be transferred, not stolen. That could mean the testimony's claim that Buff stole it contradicts the agreement where he was to hand it over. But I'm not sure. 

Another angle: Testimony 4 says the relic was stolen from Atishon's residence. The Founder's Orb is a Khura'in treasure (Evidence 1), so maybe that's not from Atishon. The Crystal of Ami Fey (Evidence 12) was stolen from Fey clan, reported by Atishon. If the testimony refers to the Crystal as part of the stolen items, then Evidence 12's report would be about that theft, but Ema's testimony says Buff stole it, which contradicts if the report's thief wasn't Buff. However, the report doesn't name the thief, just that Atishon reported it. So maybe there's no direct contradiction. 

Looking at Testimony 1: stolen artifacts found in Buff's study today. Evidence 12 is a past report. So maybe the items in the study include the Crystal from the past theft, but the report didn't implicate Buff. Thus, Ema's testimony (that Buff stole it) would contradict the fact that the theft was reported by someone else (Atishon) in the past, implying it wasn't Buff. Alternatively, the Robbery Report is from Atishon about the Crystal, so if Buff stole it later, that's possible, but maybe the report's perpetrator is different. 

Alternatively, maybe Testimony 2 mentions the statue stolen from Fey clan. The Robbery Report is about the Crystal, so that's a different item. Therefore, no contradiction. 

Wait, another evidence: Evidence 5 is Research Notes on the Song of Ceremony and the box with Founder's Orb. If the relic in question is the Founder's Orb, then Testimony 4's claim that Buff stole it from Atishon's residence would conflict with Evidence 1's description that the Orb is a Khura'in treasure, so maybe it wasn't Atishon's. Therefore, if Buff stole it from Khura'in, not Atishon, then that's a contradiction. But Testimony 4 says "the relic at the center of this dispute" (probably the Founder's Orb) was stolen from Atishon's place. But Evidence 1 says the Founder's Orb is a Khura'in treasure, so it shouldn't be Atishon's. Thus, Testimony 4's claim that Buff stole it from Atishon would contradict Evidence 1's origin. That could be a contradiction. 

Alternatively, maybe the relic in dispute is the Founder's Orb, which belongs to Khura'in, so stealing it from there, not Atishon. Therefore, Testimony 4's statement that Buff stole it from Atishon's residence would be wrong, conflicting with Evidence 1. 

If that's the case, then the pair would be Evidence 1 and Testimony 4. But the user might expect another pair. 

Alternatively, looking at Testimony 0: police have had eye on Buff for some time. Evidence 12 is a robbery report from a year ago. If the police were monitoring Buff for that past theft (from the report), then that aligns, not contradicts. 

Alternatively, maybe the contradiction is between Testimony 2 and Evidence 12. The testimony says the Crystal of Ami Fey was among the stolen items found in Buff's study. But Evidence 12's robbery report was filed by Atishon about that theft, implying that the thief was someone else (since the report is from the victim). So if Buff is now found with it, that would mean he stole it from Atishon, but the original theft was by someone else. Therefore, Ema's testimony that Buff stole it would contradict the prior robbery report (Evidence 12) which already recorded the theft as committed by another party. Thus, the current possession by Buff would be a separate theft, but the testimony claims Buff stole it, which would be possible, but maybe the report's thief is known, making it a contradiction. 

Looking at Evidence 9: an email from Buff to "PAW-711@nmail" about his research. If the email is addressed to someone else, maybe that person is the one who stole the items. 

Alternatively, the contradiction could be between Testimony 1 (stolen artifacts found in Buff's study today) and Evidence 12 (a past robbery report for the same items). If the items were already reported stolen a year ago, then finding them in Buff's study now wouldn't mean he stole them; he might have found them or been given them. Thus, Ema's testimony that Buff stole them would contradict the fact that they were already reported stolen by someone else. 

Therefore, the pair would be Evidence 12 (Robbery Report) and Testimony 2 (since Testimony 2 mentions the Crystal of Ami Fey as one of the stolen items found in Buff's study, but the Robbery Report states that it was already stolen a year ago by someone else, so Buff couldn't have stolen it anew unless he stole it from the thief, which isn't indicated). 

Alternatively, the contradiction is between Testimony 4 and Evidence 1. The relic is the Founder's Orb (Evidence 1 says it's a Khura'in treasure), but Testimony 4 says Buff stole it from Atishon's residence, implying it was Atishon's, which contradicts Evidence 1's description. 

I think the correct contradiction is between Testimony 4 and Evidence 1. Because the Founder's Orb belongs to Khura'in, so it can't be stolen from Atishon. Therefore, the answer would be {"evidence":1, "testimony":4}.
</think>

cot:
Okay, let's tackle this problem step by step. First, I need to understand what's being asked. The user wants me to find a pair of evidence and testimony that contradict each other. The answer must be in the specified JSON format, and only one pair is needed.

Looking at the provided characters, evidences, and testimonies, I need to cross-reference each testimony with the evidence to find a contradiction.

Starting with the testimonies from Testimony 0 to 6 by Atishon:

Testimony 0: Atishon says he saw Mr. Are'bal (Datz Are'bal) running out of the doctor's front door around 10 PM.

prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Trucy Wright
Description: A particular set of circumstances led to her being adopted by Mr. Wright. A world-class magician on the rise.
Character 1
Name: Athena Cykes
Description: The youngest lawyer in our agency. She apparently studied psychology in Europe.
Character 2
Name: Phoenix Wright
Description: My boss. He taught me a lot about what it means to be a lawyer.
Character 3
Name: Nahyuta Sahdmadhi
Description: A prosecutor from Khura'in. He's also a monk, which explains why he's known as the "Last Rites Prosecutor."
Character 4
Name: Dhurke Sahdmadhi
Description: Leader of the Defiant Dragons, and the man who raised me. He was a lawyer once.
Character 5
Name: Archie Buff
Description: An archeologist in Kurain Village. He was asked by someone to study the Founder's Orb.
Character 6
Name: Datz Are'bal
Description: A member of the Defiant Dragons, and Dhurke's right-hand man. He's always been one to laugh at just about anything.
Character 7
Name: Ema Skye
Description: A detective. It looks like she finally became the forensics investigator she always wanted to be.
Character 8
Name: Paul Atishon
Description: He's looking to represent Kurain Village. His remarkable self-confidence is blinding.
Character 9
Name: Sergeant Buff → Armie Buff
Description: The doctor's reclusive child. He lost his mother in a fire.
Character 10
Name: Pearl Fey
Description: Ms. Maya Fey's cousin. She's also one of Kurain Village's spirit mediums. She's always really courteous.
Character 11
Name: Miles Edgeworth
Description: Mr. Wright's best friend and the district's chief prosecutor. His frilly cravat makes a strong fashion statement.
Character 12
Name: Maya Fey
Description: Mr. Wright's former assistant. She's currently training in Khura'in. I'm told she can channel the dead.
Character 13
Name: Inga Karkhuul Khura'in
Description: Khura'in's Minister of Justice and the kingdom's second-in-command.
Character 14
Name: Rayfa Padma Khura'in
Description: Daughter of Ga'ran and princess of Khura'in who is more than a little spoiled.
Character 15
Name: Ga'ran Sigatar Khura'in
Description: The grand priestess and queen of Khura'in. It's said that she can channel the dead.
Character 16
Name: Nayna
Description: Rayfa's attendant. She disappeared all of a sudden after Minister Inga's death.
Character 17
Name: Ahlbi Ur'gaid
Description: When not undergoing monastic training, this plucky kid works as a tour guide.
Character 18
Name: Amara Sigatar Khura'in
Description: The previous queen. She is a spirit medium known as the grand priestess and possesses incredible spiritual power.
Character 19
Name: Trucy Wright
Description: An aspiring magician and my daughter. I adopted her nine years ago.
Character 20
Name: Athena Cykes
Description: The newest lawyer in my office with a background in psychology.
Character 21
Name: Apollo Justice
Description: A reliable subordinate at my office. Serious and hot-blooded with vocal chords made of steel.
Character 22
Name: Nahyuta Sahdmadhi
Description: A Khura'inese prosecutor and monk. He's also known as the "Last Rites Prosecutor."
Character 23
Name: Dhurke Sahdmadhi
Description: Leader of the Defiant Dragons and Apollo's adoptive father.
Character 24
Name: Datz Are'bal
Description: The Defiant Dragons' XO and Dhurke's right-hand man. He will laugh at just about anything.
Character 25
Name: Ema Skye
Description: A detective with a love of science. She's finally achieved her dream of becoming a forensics investigator.
Character 26
Name: Miles Edgeworth
Description: The district's chief prosecutor and my childhood friend. We used to go head-to-head back in his courtroom days.
Character 27
Name: Maya Fey
Description: A practitioner of the Kurain Channeling Technique. We used to take on all sorts of cases together.
Character 28
Name: Inga Karkhuul Khura'in
Description: Khura'in's Minister of Justice. He was killed during the hostage exchange.
Character 29
Name: Rayfa Padma Khura'in
Description: A Khura'inist priestess and crown princess of Khura'in. Her Divination Séances show the last memories of the dead.
Character 30
Name: Ga'ran Sigatar Khura'in
Description: The grand priestess and queen of Khura'in. It's said that she can channel the dead.
Character 31
Name: Nayna
Description: Rayfa's attendant. She disappeared all of a sudden after Minister Inga's death.
Character 32
Name: Ahlbi Ur'gaid
Description: When not undergoing monastic training, this plucky kid works as a tour guide.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: My beloved attorney's badge. Wearing it gets me raring to go.
Evidence 1
Name: Founder's Orb
Description: A national treasure of the Kingdom of Khura'in. None but those of in the royal family have laid eyes on it. Heating the Founder's Orb revealed the statue within. The founder's form has appeared from within. It seems only the queen knows the founder's real name.
Evidence 2
Name: Photo of My Father
Description: A picture of my biological father, Jove Justice, who died in Khura'in.
Evidence 3
Name: Study Photo
Description: Atishon saw Datz fleeing the scene the night of the murder. One of the books is stained with coffee. [caption] The victim is lying in the study next to floor-to-ceiling windows with clear glass. He is covered by books.
Evidence 4
Name: Study Diagram
Description: A diagram of the doctors's study. Note the bookcase, large window, and second-floor area. [caption] There is a tree outside the large floor-to-ceiling window. On the other side of the window is the bookshelf.
Evidence 5
Name: Research Notes
Description: Research notes on the Song of Ceremony and the box containing the Founder's Orb.
Evidence 6
Name: Orb Transfer Agreement
Description: States: "I agree to hand over the Founder's Orb to the Defiant Dragons if I will come to no harm."
Evidence 7
Name: Sarge's Drone
Description: A helicopter drone operated by the doctor's kid. Equipped with a camera and a microphone.
Evidence 8
Name: Glowing Moss
Description: Stuck to the insole of the doctor's boot. It probably got there when he went to hide the Founder's Orb.
Evidence 9
Name: E-Mail
Description: Data obtained from the doctor's computer. Includes a report on his research into the Founder's Orb. Found on the computer in Archie Buff's study, it was sent from Buff to "PAW-711@nmail" as a reply to an earlier email concerning his research into the Founder's Orb.
Evidence 10
Name: Doctor's Reading Glasses
Description: The doctor's poor eyesight meant he couldn't read anything without these. They were found on his desk.
Evidence 11
Name: Raincoat
Description: Seems the doctor wore this last night. Bears a distinctive yellow and green two-tone design.
Evidence 12
Name: Robbery Report
Description: A report filed a year ago by one Mr. Paul Atishon-Wimperson for the theft of the Crystal of Ami Fey.
Evidence 13
Name: Dr. Buff's Autopsy Report
Description: Dr. Buff was struck with the corner of some object. The time of death is between 10 and 11 PM.
Evidence 14
Name: Armie's Statement
Description: She'd fled to her room when she realized someone had moved her while she'd been unconscious on the second floor.
Evidence 15
Name: Inga's Autopsy Report
Description: Stabbed from behind. Cause of death is blood loss. Time of death is approximately 3 PM.
Evidence 16
Name: Tomb Diagram
Description: A diagram of the crime scene. Amara's sarcophagus is in the very center of the room.
Evidence 17
Name: Tomb Crime Photo
Description: A photo of Inga's body. He was stabbed in the back with a knife.
Evidence 18
Name: Gemstone
Description: Inga's button, discovered in the ashes of the tomb's incense burners. Caked in soot.
Evidence 19
Name: Pink Butterfly Pendant
Description: A pendant adorned with a pink butterfly. Seems it belongs to Dhurke. Stained with the victim's blood. A locket found at the crime scene. It actually belongs to Amara.
Evidence 20
Name: Mysterious Bloodstain
Description: A bloodstain from Amara's Tomb. Analysis reveals that it's Dhurke's blood.
Evidence 21
Name: Painkiller Shots
Description: The medication Inga used for his back pain. Said to make the pain disappear.
Evidence 22
Name: Inga's Notepad
Description: A notepad used by Inga. People's characteristics are written inside.
Evidence 23
Name: Woman's Photo
Description: A photo showing Dhurke and Amara's life on the run about 23 years ago.
Evidence 24
Name: Channeling Photo
Description: A picture taken at around 2 PM of the channeling rite.
Evidence 25
Name: Ahlbi's Statement
Description: At around 2 PM, Shah'do was surprised by a firecracker, ran into the courtyard, and stole Nayna's hat.
Evidence 26
Name: Amara's Assassination File
Description: A file containing a ton of info on the assassination of Amara Sigatar Khura'in.
Evidence 27
Name: Dhurke's Law Book
Description: A document establishing the Defense Culpability Act in the name of the queen.
Evidence 28
Name: Dhurke's Badge
Description: The symbol of Dhurke's creed: "A dragon never yields." Nahyuta never confiscated it.
Evidence 29
Name: Dhurke's Corpse Photo
Description: More than three days have passed since his death death. He was shot three times in the chest.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: Papa met with someone the night he died.
Person: Sarge
Testimony 1
Testimony: I didn't have eyes on the ground, as I'd already mounted my siege defense, but...
Person: Sarge
Testimony 2
Testimony: ...I did hear him arguing with someone in his study!
Person: Sarge
Testimony 3
Testimony: From my window, I saw the one designated "Datz" getting ejected from the premises.
Person: Sarge
Testimony 4
Testimony: After that, the man lingered around the perimeter for some time.
Person: Sarge
Testimony 5
Testimony: He must have regrouped and killed my papa in the study later -- I just know it!
Person: Sarge

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let's tackle this problem step by step. I need to find which evidence and testimony contradict each other. The user has given a list of characters, evidences, and testimonies, and I have to pick one pair that contradicts.

First, let me go through the testimonies and evidences carefully. The testimonies are from Sarge (Armie Buff), the doctor's child. The key points from the testimonies are:

Testimony 0: Papa (Dr. Buff) met with someone the night he died.
Testimony 1: Sarge was on the ground, heard an argument in the study.
Testimony 2: Saw Datz being ejected from the premises.
Testimony 3: Datz lingered around the perimeter.
Testimony 4: Datz must have killed Dr. Buff later.

Now, looking at the evidences. The relevant ones here might be Evidence 3, which mentions that Atishon saw Datz fleeing the scene. Wait, but the user's previous questions had some evidences related to the study. Let me check the evidences again.

Evidence 3: Study Photo - Atishon saw Datz fleeing. The victim (Dr. Buff) is covered by books. The caption mentions a tree outside the window, and the window is on the bookshelf side.

Evidence 4: Study Diagram shows the study's layout, with the tree outside the window. The window is on the bookshelf side.

Now, Testimony 3 says that Sarge saw Datz being ejected from the premises, and then Datz lingered around the perimeter. But if the study's window is facing a tree outside, and the door is on the other side, then if someone was ejected through the window, they would be near the tree, but the diagram might show that the door and yard are positioned such that the yard door blocks the view. Wait, the Study Diagram (Evidence 4) says that the doors to the dressing room and yard face each other, and when the yard door is open, the dressing room door blocks the view. But in this case, the study's layout might have the window with the tree outside. 

Wait, maybe I'm mixing up previous cases. Let me focus on the current problem. The key is that Sarge's testimony claims that Datz was ejected from the study and then lingered around the perimeter. But if the Study Photo (Evidence 3) shows that Atishon saw Datz fleeing, perhaps from the window area, but the Study Diagram's layout might contradict that. Alternatively, maybe the Study Diagram's layout makes it impossible for someone to be ejected through the window where the tree is, or maybe the timeline conflicts.

Alternatively, looking at Evidence 3's description: "Atishon saw Datz fleeing the scene the night of the murder. One of the books is stained with coffee." The Study Photo shows the victim covered by books next to the window. So if Datz was fleeing, perhaps the position of the body or the layout makes the testimonies conflicting.

Alternatively, maybe Testimony 3 says Sarge saw Datz being ejected from the study, but the Study Diagram (Evidence 4) might show that the study's window is positioned such that someone couldn't be ejected through there unless they were outside. Wait, the Study Diagram's caption says there's a tree outside the window, so if Datz was ejected through the window, he'd be near the tree, but the testimony says he lingered around the perimeter, which might be another area. Hmm, maybe the contradiction is between the evidence that Atishon saw Datz fleeing (Evidence 3) and Sarge's testimony that Datz was ejected and then lingered. But maybe the timeline or location details conflict.

Wait, another angle: Evidence 3's Study Photo shows that Atishon saw Datz fleeing the scene. But Sarge's testimony (Testimony 3) says that Sarge saw Datz being ejected from the study. If the Study Diagram (Evidence 4) shows the layout where the study's window is on one side, and the doors are positioned such that Sarge couldn't have seen from his vantage point. For example, if Sarge was in the second floor (as per Evidence 14: Armie's Statement mentions being on the second floor), maybe his view was blocked. 

Alternatively, maybe the Study Diagram's description says that when the yard door is open, it blocks the view into the dressing room. Wait, in the previous case with the theater, Evidence 1 (Backstage Diagram) had similar wording. Here, the Study Diagram's caption says: "There is a tree outside the large floor-to-ceiling window. On the other side of the window is the bookshelf." So the window is on one side with the tree outside, and the bookshelf is on the inside. 

If Sarge was on the second floor (as per his own statement, Evidence 14: he was unconscious on the second floor), then maybe he couldn't have seen through the window from above, but the testimony says he saw Datz being ejected from the study. Alternatively, maybe the Study Diagram's layout makes it impossible for Sarge to have seen Datz being ejected from the study's window if he was on the second floor. 

Alternatively, the contradiction could be between Testimony 3 (Sarge saw Datz being ejected) and Evidence 3 (Atishon saw Datz fleeing), but that's not a contradiction between evidence and testimony, but between testimonies. The question requires an evidence and testimony pair. 

Looking again: Testimony 3 says Sarge saw Datz being ejected from the premises. The Study Diagram (Evidence 4) might show that the study's window is on one side, and the exit is through the door. If the ejected person would have to go through the door, but the diagram's layout might block the view, making Sarge's claim impossible. Alternatively, if the Study Diagram shows that the window is blocked by the door when open, so Sarge couldn't have seen through the window from his position. 

Wait, the Study Diagram's caption says: "There is a tree outside the large floor-to-ceiling window. On the other side of the window is the bookshelf." So the window is on one wall, with the bookshelf inside. The study's door might be on another side. If Sarge was on the second floor, perhaps he couldn't see through the first floor window. So his testimony that he saw Datz ejected from the study's window might be impossible because his vantage point didn't allow that. Therefore, the contradiction is between Testimony 3 and Evidence 4 (Study Diagram). 

Alternatively, the Study Photo (Evidence 3) shows that Atishon saw Datz fleeing, but if the Study Diagram's layout makes it impossible for someone to flee through the window (like the window is too small or blocked), but that's not stated. Alternatively, if the Study Diagram's door arrangement blocks the view, making Sarge's testimony impossible. 

Alternatively, Testimony 3 says Sarge saw Datz being ejected from the study, but the Study Diagram's layout might mean that the study's window is positioned such that someone ejected through it would be near the tree, but the testimony says he lingered around the perimeter. However, the perimeter might include that area, so maybe not a contradiction. 

Alternatively, looking at Evidence 7: Sarge's Drone. The drone has a camera and microphone. If Sarge operated it, maybe he recorded the scene, contradicting his testimony that he didn't have eyes on the ground. But Testimony 1 says "I didn't have eyes on the ground, as I'd already mounted my siege defense, but..." Wait, "mounted my siege defense" might be a metaphor, but the drone could have given him a view. So if the drone was operational, then his testimony that he didn't have eyes on the ground contradicts the drone's capability. But the testimony says he heard the argument, not that he saw it via the drone. Maybe not a direct contradiction. 

Alternatively, Evidence 14 is Armie's (Sarge's) own statement that she was unconscious on the second floor. If she was unconscious, she couldn't have seen Datz being ejected, contradicting her own testimony. Wait, but Testimony 0 is from Sarge (Armie Buff), and Evidence 14 is also her statement. Let me check:

Testimony 0-5 are from Sarge (Armie Buff), and Evidence 14 is her statement: "She'd fled to her room when she realized someone had moved her while she'd been unconscious on the second floor." So she was unconscious on the second floor at some point. If she was unconscious, how could she have seen Datz being ejected? That would be a contradiction between Testimony 3 and Evidence 14. 

Ah! That's a key point. If Evidence 14 says she was unconscious on the second floor, then her testimony (Testimony 3) that she saw Datz being ejected is impossible because she was unconscious. So the contradiction is between Evidence 14 and Testimony 3. 

Wait, but the user's instruction says to pick one pair, and the answer should be in the format {"evidence": X, "testimony": Y}. The user lists the testimonies as Testimony 0 to Testimony 5 from Sarge. Testimony 3 is "I saw Datz being ejected..." but Evidence 14 (Armie's Statement) says she was unconscious on the second floor. Therefore, she couldn't have seen anything during that time. So the contradiction is between Evidence 14 and Testimony 3. 

But the user's evidences list includes Evidence 14 as "Armie's Statement" which says she was unconscious. So the correct pair is evidence 14 and testimony 3. 

Wait, but the user's previous examples had answers like {"evidence":4, "testimony":2}, so the numbering is by the evidence and testimony numbers given. Let me confirm the numbers:

Testimonies are numbered 0 to 5. The specific testimony in question is Testimony 3 ("I saw Datz being ejected..."), and the evidence is Evidence 14 ("Armie's Statement" saying she was unconscious). So the correct pair would be {"evidence":14, "testimony":3}. 

However, I need to check if the user's current setup allows this. Let me recheck the Evidence 14 description: "Armie's Statement: She'd fled to her room when she realized someone had moved her while she'd been unconscious on the second floor." So she was unconscious on the second floor at some point, but when? If the event of being unconscious happened before fleeing, then maybe she was conscious later. But if the testimony refers to the time when the ejection happened, and she was unconscious then, that's a contradiction. 

Assuming that the time of the ejection was when she was unconscious, then yes, the testimony contradicts the evidence. Therefore, the answer should be evidence 14 and testimony 3.
</think>

Evidence 12

Evidence 14

Description: She'd fled to her room when she realized someone had moved her while she'd been unconscious on the second floor.

Evidence 19

Evidence 20

Description: A bloodstain from Amara's Tomb. Analysis reveals that it's Dhurke's blood.
Evidence 21

Evidence 25

Evidence 26

Description: A document establishing the Defense Culpability Act in the name of the queen.
